sub_title: Digital Innovation Catalyst | Empowering teams for data-driven excellence | Product vision & execution | CTO, CPTO, Advisor, Ex-Nubank & Booking
summary:
As a Technology, Data, and Product Executive, I am the sum of diverse elements: 1 part executive, 1 part entrepreneur, 2 parts geek, and 2 parts forward-thinker.

With a career spanning over two decades, I have meticulously navigated the complex landscapes of fin-tech, hospitality, green-tech and clean-tech. My journey includes over a decade as an entrepreneur, where I forged my skills in the crucible of innovation.

Before dedicating myself to building a successful clean-tech Data Intelligence SaaS company, I held pivotal roles as a multi-disciplinary technology, product, and platform executive within the Fortune 500 realm.

My expertise lies in the precise orchestration of sophisticated, data-driven digital products. I excel in assembling and leading high-performance product development teams, driving them to craft solutions that exceed customer expectations.

If you're searching for a seasoned leader capable of guiding your organization to new heights in technology and product innovation, let's connect. Together, we can harness the power of knowledge, experience, and innovation to achieve greatness

profile_positions.description:
Heading the Product & Technology team consisting of productmanagers, software engineers, data engineers and datascientists. Building a high-performance and measurable operational excellence culture. Defining and leading the definition of the new architecture, way of working and delivery of the next generation data platform using AI and ML that provides customers deep insights in the sustainability of their product portfolio and its supply chain.
Also acting CIO and CISO driving SOC2, ISO27001 and other compliance trajectories, implementing IT strategies, corporate IT and driving the implementation of security policies and standards.
profile_positions.title: Chief Product & Technology Officer (CPTO)

profile_positions.description: Providing guidance on enabling measurable Engineering Operational Excellence (e.g. DORA), leading the Architecture Modeling of the company wide software technology landscape, introducing goal-setting frameworks to be used by individuals, teams, and organizations to define measurable goals and track their outcomes (OKR's) and facilitating the strategy planning cycle to define the company-wide technology strategy.
profile_positions.title: Technical Advisor

profile_positions.description: Investments, participation, startup of SaaS companies, board memberships, performing technical due diligence, strategic technical advisory services, CTO and/or CPTO roles
profile_positions.title: Technical Advisor/ CTO/ CPTO

profile_positions.description: Founded the company in October 2012 to enable data-driven business models using AI and ML for the Energy Industry and successfully grew it to over 50 employees with offices in the US and the Netherlands. Doubled revenue year-over-year and successfully pivoted to a recurring revenue model with a multiple 6-figure annual recurring revenue (ARR). After a partial exit, remaining a shareholder and regularly consults the company's CTO.
profile_positions.title: Advisor & shareholder

profile_positions.description:
After successfully founding and growing the company to a successful scale-up as a multi-disciplinary CEO,  the executive management team was expanded and professionalized. Allowing to focus on the company's short, mid and long term product strategy, professionalizing the product development life cycle organization and roadmap, defining the technology architecture, components and roadmap and intensifying the Energyworx success story from a marketing perspective. 
In the daily operations was managing the special forces team aimed to support their customers internationally as well as the product warriors team responsible for the product development. These teams have a diverse set of skills, such as Solution Architects, Data Scientists and Software Developers.
Meeting on a frequent bases with the US and European customer base, supporting new and existing customers during their on boarding process (and projects) and pushing the international expansion in a sales/pre-sales role as a strategy consultant and hands-on subject matter expert.
Presented on several international industry events, participated in discussion panels and telling the success story.
profile_positions.title: Chief Product & Technology Officer (CPTO)

profile_positions.description:
- As a multi-disciplinary CEO, successfully grew the company into a unique SaaS provider across Europe and the USA.
- Then shifted focus to defining the company's MRR strategy, product, and technology architecture roadmap as CPTO.
- Built and managed the development team using Kanban methodologies and managed projects using SCRUM for customers internationally.
- Has a proven track record of successfully managing projects for some of the largest accounts, including Engie North America, EDP, Thames Water, Nuon/Vattenfall, Alliander, Eandis, AES, Berkeley Labs, and Gexa Energy.
profile_positions.title: Founder/ CEO

profile_positions.location: Spain, The Netherlands, Brazil, US, Hybrid/Remote
profile_positions.description:
- Responsible the company's enterprise-wide strategy on platformization of products (credit card, lending, investments, insurance, marketplace, open banking, crypto, etc.) and capabilities (identity, payments, customer relationship management, etc.) and evolving the architectural muscle towards an ecosystem of platform-products working in concert
- Managed teams of Tech Program Managers, Product Managers, Designers, and Engineers to evolve and deliver core capabilities into Platforms-as-Products. Defined the strategy, identified global platform candidates, detailed them into tangible platform-product initiatives, created roadmaps, OKRs, set up teams and track them to measurable success
- Expedited the credit card product roll-out in existing and new countries from 18+ months to below 6 months as a result of improving the architecture of core product systems, increasing product development efficiency, and reducing duplications and better use of resources.
- Initiated and led the global architecture practice and team with over 40 of our most tenured and senior engineers representing all BU's, rolled out foundational mechanisms such as the standardization of documentation with C4 modeling and delivered a strategy and design for the next generation of financial services AI enabled multi-sided marketplace platform.
- Defined the vision and executed a global Identity Management Platform and Payments Orchestration Platform, including leading the program to onboard and migrate all business units.
profile_positions.title: VP of Product & Technology

profile_positions.description:
Settle is an e-money institution with licence issued by the Norwegian financial supervisory authorities, passported with rights to provide its services across all EU member states, including Great Britain.
Provided non-executive leadership on several topics around growth hacking, investments, technology, architecture and SaaS go-to market strategies.
Keywords: Google Cloud, PSD (2), digital payments, e-money, banking, financial services
profile_positions.title: Member of the Board of Directors

profile_positions.description: Accountable for the overall Technology Architecture and Strategy across the Accomodations Technology estate and leading a team of Architects and Technology Fellows in a department of self-steering teams who develop products and constantly innovate to delight our customers.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Director of Architecture & Technology Strategy Accommodations

profile_positions.description:
- Headed the Global Architecture Group and the digital transformation agenda across the brands and global Lines of Business.
- Worked with all horizontal and vertical domains and business stakeholders to develop business and technology strategies, providing guidance and vision towards our common objectives.
- Responsible for the Architecture Board and Technology Advisory Board, which promoted architectural and technology innovation by reducing platform complexities and guiding the design of systems to achieve a future-proof ecosystem of platforms that promote the evolution of our products.
- Developed deep market insight, performed competitive assessments, and informed business and technology strategy.
- Initiated and managed the co-creation of the design of the Platform-Ecosystem strategy and maintained a road map of future capabilities and investments required to meet critical business and key technology needs.
- Played a key leadership role in governing different horizontal and vertical technology and architecture decisions across different business units to ensure they aligned with and further the target architecture and road map.
- Influenced strategy, the design and development of key business capabilities, and together with the team, propagated a culture of innovation with pragmatism and excellence by leading the digital transformation agenda across the global organization.
profile_positions.title: Chief Architect

profile_positions.description:
Strategic Consulting, including enterprise and IT architecture development, SOA roadmap development, SOA governance, SOA trainings & heading the SOA competence team.
- Guiding the organisation through the SOA transformation
- Setting up guidelines and principles
- Introducing the principle of working under architecture
- Designing and implementing SOA services supporting the ETRM processes and Market Access, extending deal capture system (Openlink Endur, Cirquent, SolARC RA).
- Webservice security management (OWSM)
- Solution architecture for SalesQuoting and ContractBooking to dealcapture system (BPEL)
- Design and implementation of end-2-end monitoring of service chains.
- Design and coordination of SOA topology across the different tradefloors per country
- Solution architecture for market data management system supporting different feeds.
- Design and roll-out of an enterprise wide Common Object Model supporting the energy trade artifacts
profile_positions.title: Enterprise Architect

profile_positions.description: Research and prototyping in the area of data management, real-time analytics and data visualization for the energy & utilities sector. Designing sophisticated models and algorithms supporting the flood of data that is entering the smart grid.
profile_positions.title: Guest Researcher

profile_positions.description: Worked in the NUON staff department ITSA (IT Strategy & Architecture) which is part of the CIO, facilitating the creation of the SOA blueprint from an organizational and architectural point of view. Bridging the gap between the architecture long-term vision and the current situation laid out against a solid roadmap. Applying SOA principles and guidelines to business problems, translating it to architectural and technological components, approaching it in a pragmatic way to deliver SOA adoption: step by step.
profile_positions.title: Enterprise Architect SOA

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the solution area integration architectures and technologies within the Vattenfall Group. For the Benelux involving the short-term consolidation and migration of the several integration platforms that exist within the Vattenfall group. As well as defining reference architecture, target architecture and the roadmap on how to get there.
profile_positions.title: Group Solution Architect Integration & SOA
